page.title: 06Bryanston Home Farm
page.content: Most of the area is farmed. One of the three farms in the block is the {Bryanston Home Farm.}7 workers deal with the 780 acres of chalkland. { Machinery } {New Value 7 tractors @Â£15,000 each 1 fork lift Â£20,000 1 combine Â£28,000 1 forage harvester Â£6,000 2 bailers @ Â£3,000 each 1 corn dryer Â£20,000 The land is valued at Â£1,400,000. Rent is Â£40,000 p.a. There are no direct grants or subsidies. Income averages Â£12,000 p.a. {Livestock: }220 dairy cows, 300 beef. Milk yield: 1,000,100 litres p.a. {Crops:}cereals Yield per acre: wheat 4 tonnes. barley 3 tonnes. Political decision making in Brussels produces the farmer's main problems.
